title: Finding Notes on the Piano
description: Learn to navigate the piano keyboard — find white keys, black keys, sharps, and octaves.

steps.title: The Piano Layout
steps.description: The piano keyboard has a repeating pattern of white and black keys. Black keys come in groups of 2 and 3. The note C is always just to the left of a group of 2 black keys. Once you can find C, you can find every other note!

steps.title: Find Middle C
steps.description: Press Middle C (C4). It's just to the left of the group of two black keys in the middle of the keyboard.

steps.title: Find D
steps.description: D is the white key between the two black keys. Press D4.
steps.hint: D4 is one whole step (2 keys) above C4.

steps.title: Find E
steps.description: E is the white key just to the right of the two black keys. Press E4.

steps.title: Find a Sharp — C#
steps.description: Sharps are the black keys. C# is the first black key in the group of two. Press C#4.
steps.hint: C#4 is the black key directly to the right of C4.

steps.title: Play C in Two Octaves
steps.description: An octave is the distance from one note to the next note with the same name. Play C4 and C5 together.
steps.hint: C5 is 12 keys higher than C4 (MIDI 72).
